p: Controlling Listeria monocytogenes in food has become a major preoccupation in the food industry and storage. The purpose of this experiment was to determine the efficacy of ClEO to repress the growth of Listeria monocytogenes ATCC 19117 in raw minced meat beef under storage at 4 °C. Therefore, the effect of ClEO on Listeria monocytogenes ATCC 19117 was investigated to confirm its effect and clarify its action mechanism. The kinetics was performed using different concentrations of ClEO (2 MIC and 3MIC). As shown in Fig. 3, at day 0, the number of L. monocytogenes was found to be the same for all meat samples ( P > 0.05). Over the storage period at 4 °C, numbers of L. monocytogenes were higher in untreated samples than treated samples with 0.06 and 0.312 mg of ClEO /g of raw minced meat beef: at a concentration of 2 and 3 MIC, growth of L. monocytogenes count was reduced by 2.5 log cycles after 4 and 6 days of storage at 4 °C respectively (Fig. 3).
